title: Instructional Design for Optimal Demonstration-Based Training: Timing Selection Pedagogy

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Practical demonstration video analysis and optimization training program for professionals in medical/legal/technical fields. Learning methodologies to select optimal learning moments by multi-angle recording of a single trainer's demonstration

learning_goals: Identifies optimal demonstration timing with 80% accuracy by combining information-theoretic measures (viewpoint entropy) and instructional design-based metrics
Analyzes educational video quality using a 3-tier checklist evaluating trainer’s body posture, facial expressions, and hand gesture visibility
Applies a decision-making process for selecting high-impact learning moments from multi-camera streams in demonstration videos with over 90% consistency
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
